SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Board
An abstract representation of a Tetris game board.
BoardGrid
Represents the grid (playfield) of the Tetris board.
BoardMessageType
Enumeration defining the protocol messages used for communication between boards.
BoardWithPhysics
A concrete implementation of Board that includes a full physics engine.
CustomMessageDialog
A custom modal dialog for displaying messages to the user.
GameCommunicationHandler
Initializes and manages a game session between two matched players.
GameMode
Enumeration representing the different types of game modes a client can request.
Gravity
Manages the downward movement mechanics (Gravity) and locking logic for the active Tetromino.
InputAction
Enumeration representing the possible actions that a player can perform in the game.
ITetromino
Represents the 'I' Tetromino (the straight line).
JTetromino
Represents the 'J' Tetromino (L-shape with a left-facing hook).
KeyBindingsManager
Manages the persistence of key bindings.
KeyInputHandler
Handles keyboard input for the application.
LobbiesHandler
Manages private game lobbies.
LobbySearchDialog
A dialog allowing the user to enter a specific Room ID to join an online lobby.
LocalTwoPlayerModernTetrisPanel
Manages a local 1v1 Modern Tetris game.
LocalTwoPlayerNESPanel
Manages a local 1v1 NES (Classic) Tetris game.
LocalTwoPlayersTetrisPanel
An abstract base class for local multiplayer games (same machine).
LTetromino
Represents the 'L' Tetromino (L-shape with a right-facing hook).
Main
The entry point for the Tetris Distribuidos client application.
MainFrame
The main application window (JFrame).
MainPanel
The primary container panel for the application's user interface.
MatchmakingHandler
Handles the initial negotiation (handshake) with a connected client.
ModernButton
A custom JButton implementation with a modern look and feel.
ModernScrollBar
A custom BasicScrollBarUI to provide a modern, dark-themed scrollbar.
ModernTetrisBoardWithPhysics
A concrete implementation of a playable board using Modern Tetris rules.
ModernTetrisConfig
Configuration constants for the Modern Tetris game mode.
NESBoardWithPhysics
A concrete board implementation that emulates Classic (NES) Tetris physics.
NESConfig
Configuration constants for NES (Classic) Tetris emulation.
NESRotationSystem
Implements the Nintendo Rotation System (NRS) used in the classic NES Tetris.
NESTetrominoesGenerator
Implements the NES Tetris random generation algorithm.
OnlineTwoPlayersModernTetrisPanel
Manages an online 1v1 Modern Tetris game.
OnlineTwoPlayersNESPanel
Manages an online 1v1 NES (Classic) Tetris game.
OnlineTwoPlayersPanel
An abstract base class for all online multiplayer Tetris game modes.
OTetromino
Represents the 'O' Tetromino (the Square).
PlayerCommunicationHandler
A unidirectional relay that forwards data from one player to another.
PlayerInputHandler
Handles processing of raw keyboard input and applying it to the game state.
QuickPlayHandler
Manages the matchmaking queue for Quick Play modes.
RandomBag7TetrominoesGenerator
Implements the "7-Bag" Random Generator used in Modern Tetris Guidelines.
ReceivedGarbageHandler
Handles the logic for receiving and applying garbage lines in multiplayer games.
ReceiverBoard
A board implementation used to replicate the state of a remote player.
ReceiverBoardInputHandler
A specialized Thread that listens for incoming game updates from an input stream.
ReceiverModernTetrisBoard
A board that visualizes the state of a remote Modern Tetris player.
ReceiverModernTetrisBoardInputHandler
An extended input handler for Modern Tetris games.
ReceiverNESBoard
A board that visualizes the state of a remote NES Tetris player.
RotationSystem
Abstract base class representing a rotation system.
RotationSystemFactory
Factory class for creating specific RotationSystem instances.
RotationSystemType
Enumeration of the supported rotation algorithms.
SenderBoardOutputHandler
Handles the encoding and transmission of game events to an output stream.
SenderModernTetrisBoardWithPhysics
A Modern Tetris board that broadcasts its state to an output stream.
SenderNESBoardWithPhysics
An NES Tetris board that broadcasts its state to an output stream.
Server
The main entry point for the Tetris Server.
ServerConnector
Handles the logic for connecting the client to the game server.
SettingsPanel
The settings screen that allows users to configure key bindings for Player 1 and Player 2.
SinglePlayerModernTetrisPanel
A concrete panel implementation for the Single Player Modern Tetris mode.
SinglePlayerNESPanel
A concrete panel implementation for the Single Player NES (Classic) Tetris mode.
SinglePlayerTetrisPanel
An abstract base class for single-player Tetris game modes.
StartMenuPanel
The initial screen of the application, displaying the game title and navigation options.
STetromino
Represents the 'S' Tetromino (Right-facing skew/zigzag).
SuperRotationSystem
Implements the Super Rotation System (SRS), the current standard for modern Tetris games.
SuperRotationSystemPlus
An enhanced version of the Super Rotation System (SRS+).
TetrisPanel
An abstract base class representing a generic Tetris game panel.
Tetromino
Abstract base class representing a Tetris piece (Tetromino).
TetrominoCell
Utility class for rendering individual blocks (cells) of a Tetromino.
TetrominoesGenerator
Abstract base class for Tetromino generation algorithms.
TetrominoesGeneratorFactory
Factory class for creating TetrominoesGenerator instances.
TetrominoesGeneratorType
Enumeration of the supported random generation algorithms.
TetrominoesQueue
A UI component that manages and displays the queue of upcoming Tetrominoes.
TetrominoFactory
Factory class for creating Tetromino instances.
TetrominoHolder
A UI component that manages the "Hold" mechanic.
TetrominoShadow
Represents the "Ghost Piece" or Shadow.
TetrominoType
Enumeration representing the seven standard Tetromino shapes.
TTetromino
Represents the 'T' Tetromino (T-shape).
TwoPlayersTetrisPanel
An abstract base class for all two-player Tetris game modes.
WaitingOpponentPanel
A panel displayed while the client is negotiating a connection with the server.
ZTetromino
Represents the 'Z' Tetromino (Left-facing skew/zigzag).
